agenda.description: HOUSE OF REPRESENTATIVES NOTICE OF PUBLIC HEARING COMMITTEE: Public Education TIME & DATE: 8:00 AM, Tuesday, March 19, 2019 PLACE: E2.036 CHAIR: Rep. Dan Huberty *The order in which bills are heard is at the discretion of the chair* *Testimony will be limited to two (2) minutes* HB 462 Geren | et al. Relating to the basic allotment and guaranteed yield under the public school finance system. HB 548 Canales Relating to reporting certain truancy information through the Public Education Information Management System. HB 735 VanDeaver | et al. Relating to the calculation of the rollback tax rate of a school district and a related study. HB 1160 Johnson, Jarvis Relating to the use of the compensatory education allotment for a school district's school guidance and counseling program or counseling or social work services. HB 1182 Goodwin | et al. Relating to personal financial literacy courses for high school students in public schools. HB 1199 Miller Relating to public school compliance with dyslexia screening and testing requirements. HB 1388 VanDeaver Relating to indicators of achievement under the public school accountability system. HB 1453 Bernal Relating to updating requirements for special education training and the make up of the SBEC Board. HB 1556 VanDeaver Relating to school district purchasing of and contracting for goods and services. HB 1597 Lambert Relating to establishing residency for purposes of admission into public schools. HB 1632 Bell, Keith | et al. Relating to students eligible to receive compensatory, intensive, and accelerated instructional services. HB 1639 Martinez Relating to the authority of an independent school district to change the date of the general election and terms for officers. HB 1664 King, Ken Relating to the requirement of certain administrators of certain educational entities to report certain educator misconduct to the State Board for Educator Certification. HB 1679 Price Relating to student loan repayment assistance for school counselors employed by a school district. HB 1773 Middleton Relating to school district use of relocatable educational facilities. HB 1823 Cortez Relating to the reduction of school district property taxes as a result of the school facilities allotment. HB 2210 Bell, Keith | et al. Relating to the consideration for public school accountability purposes of certain students receiving residential services in state hospitals. HB 2116 White | et al. Relating to the inclusion of certain students as students at risk of dropping out of school. HB 2424 Ashby Relating to the creation of a micro-credential certification program for public school educator continuing education. HB 2778 King, Tracy O. Relating to the allocation of expenses of a joint election to certain school districts. HB 3134 Middleton Relating to the operation of a public school transportation system. HJR 24 Geren Proposing a constitutional amendment requiring the state to pay at least 50 percent of the cost of maintaining and operating the public school system and prohibiting the comptroller from certifying legislation containing an appropriation for public education unless the requirement is met. The committee will also discuss a committee substitute for HB 3. NOTICE OF ASSISTANCE AT PUBLIC MEETINGS Persons with disabilities who plan to attend this meeting and who may need assistance, such as a sign language interpreter, are requested to contact Stacey Nicchio at (512) 463-0850, 72 hours prior to the meeting so that appropriate arrangements can be made.
